item.name: WorkspaceUploadRequest
item.description: Upload request details - single upload request response

item.name: Creates a new upload request within a workspace

request.name: Creates a new upload request within a workspace

description.content: This operation creates a new upload request within a workspace. The upload request includes name, description, due date, and user assignments. Upload requests can be created as drafts or sent immediately based on the status field.
(Required) The ID of the account
(Required) The ID of the workspace

response.name: Upload request successfully created

description.content: Added as a part of security scheme: oauth2

item.name: Gets upload requests within a workspace

request.name: Gets upload requests within a workspace

description.content: This operation retrieves a list of upload requests within a workspace. Each upload request includes details such as ID, name, description, status, owner information, associated documents, assignments, and various dates.
(Required) The ID of the account
(Required) The ID of the workspace

request.name: Gets details for a specific upload request

(Required) The ID of the account

(Required) The ID of the upload request

item.name: Updates a specific upload request

request.name: Updates a specific upload request

description.content: This operation updates a specific upload request within a workspace. Only draft upload requests can be edited. The editable fields are name, description, due date, and status. Status changes are restricted - only transitions from draft to in_progress are allowed. Attempting to update a non-draft upload request will result in an INVALID_STATUS error. Attempting an invalid status change will result in an INVALID_STATUS_CHANGE error.
(Required) The ID of the account
(Required) The ID of the workspace
(Required) The ID of the upload request to update

response.name: Upload request successfully updated

item.name: Workspaces
Gets workspaces available to the calling user

request.name: Gets workspaces available to the calling user

description.content:
This operation retrieves a list of workspaces available to the calling user. It returns basic information about each workspace, including its unique identifier (ID), name, and metadata such as when it was created and by whom.

Pagination is supported by passing `start_position` and `count` in the request. The response will include `resultSetSize`, `start_position`, and `end_position` which may be utilized for subsequent requests.
Number of workspaces to return. Defaults to the maximum which is 100
Position of the first item in the total results. Defaults to 0
(Required) The ID of the account

response.name: Workspaces successfully retrieved

description.content: Number of workspaces to return. Defaults to the maximum which is 100
Position of the first item in the total results. Defaults to 0
Added as a part of security scheme: oauth2

response.name: Bad request. See ErrorCode and Message for details

Position of the first item in the total results. Defaults to 0
Added as a part of security scheme: oauth2

item.name: Creates a new workspace

request.name: Creates a new workspace

description.content:
This operation creates a new workspace. The calling user is automatically added as a member of the workspace with the role of Manage.

Once created, the `workspace_id` is utilized to associate tasks such as envelopes. Participants on tasks will automatically be added to the workspace with the Participate role.
(Required) The ID of the account

response.name: Workspace successfully created

item.name: Returns the roles the caller can assign to workspace users

request.name: Returns the roles the caller can assign to workspace users

description.content:
This operation returns roles that are assignable to users in the workspace based on the caller's role in the workspace. Roles available include Manage (internal) and Participate (external). Participate is the default role.

Users within the account are considered "Internal" and may be assigned any role. Users outside the account are considered "External" and may only be assigned "External" roles.

Pagination is supported by passing `start_position` and `count` in the request. The response will include `resultSetSize`, `start_position`, and `end_position` which may be utilized for subsequent requests.
A search filter that returns assignable roles by the beginning of the role name
The index position within the total result set from which to start returning values. The default value is 0
The number of results to return. This value must be a number between 1 and 100 (default)
(Required) The ID of the account
(Required) The ID of the workspace

response.name: Assignable roles successfully retrieved

description.content: A search filter that returns assignable roles by the beginning of the role name
The index position within the total result set from which to start returning values. The default value is 0
The number of results to return. This value must be a number between 1 and 100 (default)
Added as a part of security scheme: oauth2

response.name: Bad request. See ErrorCode and Message for details

description.content: A search filter that returns assignable roles by the beginning of the role name
The index position within the total result set from which to start returning values. The default value is 0
The number of results to return. This value must be a number between 1 and 100 (default)
Added as a part of security scheme: oauth2

description.content: A search filter that returns assignable roles by the beginning of the role name

Added as a part of security scheme: oauth2

item.name: Creates an envelope with the given documents. Returns the ID of the created envelope

request.name: Creates an envelope with the given documents. Returns the ID of the created envelope

description.content:
This operation creates an envelope associated with the workspace. Using the `envelope_id` from the response, the [eSignature API](https://developers.docusign.com/docs/esign-rest-api/) may be utilized to modify the envelope and ultimately send it.

Envelope recipients will automatically be granted Participate access to the workspace. Envelope recipients will receive consolidated notifications from Docusign Workspaces rather than standard individual envelope notifications.

Docusign Connect events may be utilized to receive updates to individual envelope events.

The `envelopes` operation on the workspace may be utilized to query the status of all the envelopes in the workspace.

When `document_ids` is empty or excluded, the envelope is created without any documents from the workspace. eSignature API calls, including adding documents and templates, may be utilized to modify the envelope before it is sent. The eSignature API must be utilized to send the envelope.
(Required) The ID of the account
(Required) The ID of the workspace

response.name: The envelope was successfully created

description.content: Added as a part of security scheme: oauth2

response.name: Bad request. See ErrorCode and Message for details

description.content: Added as a part of security scheme: oauth2

response.name: Not authorized to make this request

description.content: Added as a part of security scheme: oauth2

response.name: Internal Server Error

description.content: Added as a part of security scheme: oauth2

item.name: Returns the envelopes associated with the given workspace

request.name: Returns the envelopes associated with the given workspace

description.content:
This operation retrieves a list of all associated workspace envelopes. The [`status`](https://support.docusign.com/s/document-item?bundleId=oeq1643226594604&topicId=wdm1578456348227.html) on each envelope can be used to track envelope progress. Statuses are formatted as ProperCase. e.g. `Sent`, `WaitingForOthers`, `Completed`, etc.

Based on the permissions of the caller, additional envelope details may be retrieved from the [eSignature API](https://developers.docusign.com/docs/esign-rest-api/) using the `envelope_id`.
(Required) The ID of the account
(Required) The ID of the workspace

response.name: Envelopes successfully retrieved

description.content: Added as a part of security scheme: oauth2

response.name: Bad request. See ErrorCode and Message for details

description.content: Added as a part of security scheme: oauth2

response.name: Not authorized to make this request

description.content: Added as a part of security scheme: oauth2

item.name: WorkspaceDocuments
Get documents in the workspace accessible to the calling user

request.name: Get documents in the workspace accessible to the calling user

description.content:
This operation retrieves the documents in the workspace that are accessible to the calling user. Documents may be added directly or automatically through tasks such as envelopes. Documents may be used to create envelopes.

Pagination is supported by passing `start_position` and `count` in the request. The response will include `resultSetSize`, `start_position`, and `end_position` which may be utilized for subsequent requests.
Number of documents to return. Defaults to the maximum which is 100
Position of the first item in the total results. Defaults to 0
Filter documents where Name contains the filter. Defaults to null, to not filter
(Required) The ID of the account
(Required) The ID of the workspace

response.name: Documents successfully retrieved

description.content: Number of documents to return. Defaults to the maximum which is 100
Position of the first item in the total results. Defaults to 0
Filter documents where Name contains the filter. Defaults to null, to not filter
Added as a part of security scheme: oauth2

response.name: Bad request. See ErrorCode and Message for details

description.content: Number of documents to return. Defaults to the maximum which is 100
Position of the first item in the total results. Defaults to 0
Filter documents where Name contains the filter. Defaults to null, to not filter
Added as a part of security scheme: oauth2

response.name: Not authorized to make this request

description.content: Number of documents to return. Defaults to the maximum which is 100
Position of the first item in the total results. Defaults to 0
Filter documents where Name contains the filter. Defaults to null, to not filter
Added as a part of security scheme: oauth2

response.name: Internal Server Error

Added as a part of security scheme: oauth2

item.name: Add a document to a workspace via file contents upload

request.name: Add a document to a workspace via file contents upload

description.content:
This operation adds a document to a workspace via file contents upload. The file is passed in the request body as a multipart/form-data file. The file name is used as the document name.

Once added, it may be used to create an envelope associated with the workspace.
(Required) The ID of the account
(Required) The ID of the workspace
The file within the multipart/form-data

item.name: WorkspaceUsers
Retrieves the list of users in the given workspace

request.name: Retrieves the list of users in the given workspace

description.content:
This operations retrieves the users in a workspace. Users sent envelopes or assigned tasks will automatically be added to the workspace with the Participate role.

Pagination is supported by passing `start_position` and `count` in the request. The response will include `resultSetSize`, `start_position`, and `end_position` which may be utilized for subsequent requests.
Number of workspace users to return. Defaults to the maximum which is 100.
Position of the first item in the total results. Defaults to 0.
Returns workspace users filtered by Name and Email
Sorts results. Options are `first_name_asc`, `first_name_desc`, `last_name_asc`, `last_name_desc`, `email_asc`, `email_desc`. Defaults to `last_name_desc`
(Required) The ID of the account
(Required) The ID of the workspace

response.name: The workspace user was successfully retrieved

item.name: Adds a user to the workspace by email address

request.name: Adds a user to the workspace by email address

description.content:
This operation manually adds an internal or external user to a specific workspace by email address. Users within the account are considered "Internal" and may be assigned any role. Users outside the account are considered "External" and may only be assigned the Participate role. This operation is not typically needed for adding external participants to a Workspace as they will be automatically added as tasks are assigned.

Available role IDs can be retrieved via the Assignable Roles operation on a workspace. If the `role_id` is not passed, the user is added with the Participate role.
(Required) The ID of the account
(Required) The ID of the workspace

response.name: The user was successfully added to the workspace

description.content: Added as a part of security scheme: oauth2
